amendment.description: To protect patient access to current and future treatments for a range of serious conditions, such as cancer, Alzheimer's disease, HIV/AIDS, Parkinson's disease, and sickle cell disease, among numerous others.

vote.text: Amendment SA 5389 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 50. Record Vote Number: 298.

action.text: Amendment SA 5389 proposed by Senator Marshall to Amendment SA 5194. (consideration: CR S4181; text: CR S4181) To protect patient access to current and future treatments for a range of serious conditions, such as cancer, Alzheimer's disease, HIV/AIDS, Parkinson's disease, and sickle cell disease, among numerous others.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 5389 proposed by Senator Marshall to Amendment SA 5194.
Senate amendment not agreed to: Amendment SA 5389 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 50. Record Vote Number: 298.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 5389 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 50. Record Vote Number: 298.
